alternate_names: K-Ci & JoJo x DeVante Swing x Mr. Dalvin

description.plain: Started in 1983, Jodeci is comprised of two sets of brothers—Cedric and Joel Hailey (also known as K-Ci and JoJo) and Donald and Dalvin Degrate (also known as DeVante Swing and Mr. Dalvin). Jodeci were once known as the “bad boys of R&B,” notable particularly because they were actually boys at the time, breaking out as teenagers in 1991 with their debut album and its title ballad, “Forever My Lady.” Natives of North Carolina, they were discovered by Heavy D, who overheard their demo when an A&R at Uptown was in the process of passing on them. Heavy D introduced Jodeci to Uptown founder Andre Harrell, who signed them after they sang in his office, and handed them off to his then-protégé Puff Daddy, who outfitted the group in dark shades and coordinating leather ensembles. The look, along with the streetwise soul found in songs like “Cry 4 U” and “Feenin” (as well as a few run-ins with the law) made them the antithesis to good-guy personas of then-peaking R&B superstars Boyz II Men. Devante, who along with Mr. Dalvin held down production duties for the group, founded the Swing Mob, a collective responsible for the discovery of musical geniuses like Timbaland, Missy Elliott, and Static Major. As a group, Jodeci would go on to release three critically-acclaimed album in the ‘90s, before disappearing from the limelight. K-Ci and JoJo splintered off as a duo in 1997, producing hit single “All My Life” and, eventually, five albums, but adoring fans never let go of their Jodeci obsession. In March, the group released The Past, The Present, The Future, the first Jodeci album in two decades. Jodeci, if y'all reading this, where’d you go?

songs.full_title: Come & Talk to Me (Remix) by Jodeci
songs.title: Come & Talk to Me (Remix)

description.plain:
“Come and Talk to Me” was released as the fourth single from Jodeci’s 1991 multi-platinum debut album Forever My Lady. The song was another hit from the album as the gold single—propelled by the popularity of this remix—peaked at #11 on the Billboard Hot 100 and topped the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart in 1992.

This remix was produced by Sean “Puff Daddy” Combs, who was working his way up the corporate ladder from his intern position at Uptown Records when he decided to mix a sample of the drums and bassline from EPMD’s “You’re a Customer” with piano melodies and Jodeci’s vocals. He talked about how this remix came together in a 2014 interview with GQ magazine:

I got an opportunity one night when Teddy Riley didn’t show up to the studio. He had a session at Chung King, this famous studio downtown. So I said, I’m just gonna utilize this time. I had this idea, which was influenced by the mixtapes of Brucie B. and Kid Capri: They would blend hip-hop beats with R&B a cappellas. I took one of Jodeci’s a cappellas and put an EPMD beat underneath it, and it was the first record I produced: “Come and Talk to Me,” the remix.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pQxJ1gII7bc

This remix saw a resurgence in popularity after the “You look so sexy, you really turn me on” line was sampled in LikyBo’s 2017 song “Kraazy,” which became a viral hit on the social media platform TikTok at the end of 2019 going into 2020.

songs.full_title: Cry For You by Jodeci
songs.title: Cry For You

description.plain: “Cry For You” was released as the first single from Jodeci’s multi-platinum sophomore album Diary of a Mad Band. The single achieved gold status as it peaked at #15 on the Billboard Hot 100 and topped the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart for four weeks. The music video was shot in the desert of Death Valley National Park in California.

songs.full_title: Freek'n You (Mr. Dalvin's Freek Mix) by Jodeci (Ft. Ghostface Killah & Raekwon)
songs.title: Freek’n You (Mr. Dalvin’s Freek Mix)
songs.title_with_featured: Freek'n You (Mr. Dalvin's Freek Mix) (Ft. Ghostface Killah & Raekwon)

description.plain:
Mr. Dalvin provides the remix for “Freek'n You,” the first single on Jodeci’s third album, The Show, The After-Party, The Hotel. The remix features Wu-Tang Clan members Raekwon and Ghostface Killah, fresh off their performance on Raekwon’s debut solo album, Only Built 4 Cuban Linx… Mr. Dalvin, Rae & Ghost would later connect on a remix of Raekwon’s single “Rainy Dayz.”

Initially, a version of the remix with only Raekwon’s verse was released as a B-Side on Jodeci’s “Love U 4 Life” single, but the version with both Rae and Ghost was released as a B-Side on the single for “Get on Up.”

Mr. Dalvin provides the remix for “Freek'n You,” the first single on Jodeci’s third album, The Show, The After-Party, The Hotel. The remix features Wu-Tang Clan members Raekwon and Ghostface Killah, fresh off their performance on Raekwon’s debut solo album, Only Built 4 Cuban Linx… Mr. Dalvin, Rae & Ghost would later connect on a remix of Raekwon’s single “Rainy Dayz.”

Initially, a version of the remix with only Raekwon’s verse was released as a B-Side on Jodeci’s “Love U 4 Life” single, but the version with both Rae and Ghost was released as a B-Side on the single for “Get on Up.”

songs.full_title: Lately by Jodeci
songs.title: Lately

description.plain:
A song about a man’s suspicions regarding his woman’s extracurricular activities, “Lately” was originally released as a single from Stevie Wonder’s 1980 album Hotter Than July and Jodeci covered the song during their set on Uptown MTV Unplugged in 1993. Jodeci’s cover was released as a promotional single and became a big hit for the group, peaking at #4 on the Billboard Hot 100 and topping the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart while achieving gold status. A studio version of the track was also produced for the single release.

During an appearance on BET’s Video Soul with Donnie Simpson, K-Ci talked about how the song came together:

We had did the song before, once before in the studio and it came out cool. We let Andre Harrell hear it, and he said, ‘Why don’t y’all do this on the next album?’ So we just thought about it but never had done it. So we just up one day and just recorded it, man, and now it’s out, video and everything. […] We don’t like doing other people’s songs, still, but it’s Stevie, you know, it’s Stevie, and you just hope Stevie likes it.

They performed the song with a special appearance from Stevie Wonder on The Arsenio Hall Show and they also performed the song in the “Hollywood Swingin’ (Part 2)” episode of Martin, which according to K-Ci & JoJo was unexpectedly interrupted by the show’s star, Martin Lawrence.

songs.full_title: Get On Up by Jodeci
songs.title: Get On Up

description.plain: This is song is an upbeat, and uplifting 90’s r&b song that brightens up your mood. The type of song that you’d listen to at a barbecue, while enjoying the company of friends and the festivities around. This song is all about having a good ass time.The mood is just right, the negativity is out of the atmosphere, and the goal of the night/day is to just have a good time.

songs.full_title: Nobody Wins by Jodeci (Ft. B.o.B)
songs.title: Nobody Wins

description.plain:
You can fall into the trap that a lot of artists fall into by just putting records out there because fans are excited and start tarnishing your legacy and body of work you’ve created. People waited all these years for some quality music – not just throwing music out there. – Dalvin “Mr. Dalvin” DeGrate

Following an 18 year hiatus, the North Carolina quartet finally blesses its audience with a new track, which is no small feat considering the group gave us hits such as ‘Forever My Lady’, ‘Come And Talk To Me’, ‘Feenin'’. They first performed a snippet of this new song at the 2014 Soul Train Music Awards in Las Vegas.

songs.full_title: Play Thang by Jodeci
songs.title: Play Thang

description.plain:
“Play Thang” is the 9th track released on the Forever My Lady album on May 28, 1991. It is a prime example of one of the more upbeat new jack swing songs that Jodeci recorded early on in their career. It is also an epitome of the heavy, more authentic hip-hop influenced tracks that Jodeci made to shift the consensus with (more mature) hip-hop like R&B in the early 90’s with its cursing and overt sexual lyrics, (which were not common traits of the contemporary R&B which preceded it).

By the time you start reading the first verse you’ll notice something that will hit you: the presence of another character besides K-Ci and the girl who is referred to as his “Play Thang”, which is another girl that seems to also be in a relationship with K-Ci. The lyrics that are sung basically describe a man talking his girlfriend where he reveals to her that he has a friend with benefits. Despite this, the man tries to keep his girlfriend by telling her that he still has enough feelings for her to make him want to stay in a relationship.

songs.full_title: Lately (Studio Version) by Jodeci
songs.title: Lately (Studio Version)

description.plain:
After the success of their live cover of Stevie Wonder’s “Lately” from their 1993 Uptown MTV Unplugged performance, Jodeci produced a studio version of their track. Jodeci’s version of “Lately” was released as a promotional single and became a big hit for the group, peaking at #4 on the Billboard Hot 100 and topping the Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs chart while achieving gold status. This studio version was originally only available on the single but was later included on some re-issues of Jodeci’s sophomore album Diary of a Mad Band.

During an appearance on BET’s Video Soul with Donnie Simpson, K-Ci talked about how the song came together:

We had did the song before, once before in the studio and it came out cool. We let Andre Harrell hear it, and he said, ‘Why don’t y’all do this on the next album?’ So we just thought about it but never had done it. So we just up one day and just recorded it, man, and now it’s out, video and everything. […] We don’t like doing other people’s songs, still, but it’s Stevie, you know, it’s Stevie, and you just hope Stevie likes it.

They performed the song with a special appearance from Stevie Wonder on The Arsenio Hall Show and they also performed the song in the “Hollywood Swingin’ (Part 2)” episode of Martin, which according to K-Ci & JoJo was unexpectedly interrupted by the show’s star, Martin Lawrence.

songs.full_title: Interlude (553-Nasty) by Jodeci
songs.title: Interlude (553-Nasty)

description.plain: This interlude is about K-Ci, and his brother JoJo expressing how much they really do love the woman that they were with. “You’re mine, I know you’re mine” telling the young lady, that she is in fact, his woman. The last few seconds of the interlude is basically the members of Jodeci meeting up with the homeboys, talking about the beautiful lady’s in the city that they’re in, and the absence of group member DeVante Swing. While the homeboys go on about the “flow” of going out and meeting new beautiful lady’s of the current city they’re in, JoJo wraps up the interlude with a phone call to talk to his lady.

songs.lyrics:
Success (Remix) Lyrics[Intro: Mr. Dalvin]
DeVante, K-Ci, Mr. Dalvin, JoJo
And it's on, still on, uh

[Verse 1: K-Ci, Mr. Dalvin]
Way back in 1989, I believe it was
We packed up DeVante’s car and headed up north
A little money in our pockets, but that didn’t stop us
We had to leave, oh yeah
Leaving our family behind back home
It was so sad but we said “Mama, we’re gone”
We were leaving in a rush — mama, don’t fuss
We just wanna succeed — yes, we do (Come on)

[Chorus: Jodeci, K-Ci]
For those who thought we, wouldn’t make it (Uh)
But we had to, ‘cause we had our made up mind (Yeah)
(And you know who you are)
Success is not hard to find
(Have a little faith and you will go far) (Uh)
For those who thought we, wouldn’t make it
But we had to, ‘cause we had our made up mind
(No one could stop us, no, no)
Success is not hard to find
(We had to go, we had to go)
(Come on)
[Verse 2: K-Ci, Mr. Dalvin]
We rolled around the Big Apple all night long (Uh)
Every time listening to our demo song
Not a place to sleep, nothing was cheap
But we still drove on — yes, we did (Uh)
Ended up in this motel far out away
Didn’t really care, we were still gonna stay
‘Cause we’re living life, we wasn’t gonna cry
There was always the next day
You just gotta believe it, yes you do, yes you do

[Chorus: Jodeci, K-Ci]
For those who thought we (For those who thought we), wouldn’t make it (Wouldn't make it)
But we had to (Yeah, yeah), ‘cause we had our made up mind
(No one could stop us, no, no)
Success is not hard to find
(No, no, no, no, no, I said nobody, nobody)
For those who thought we (Thought we), wouldn’t make it (Wouldn't make it)
But we had to, ‘cause we had our made up mind
(Well, well, well, well)
Success is not hard to find
(Don’t you know we just gotta keep moving on)

[Bridge: Jodeci, K-Ci]
Now we just gotta keep on
(Singing your favorite song)
Singing your favorite song
(Song after song after song)
Getting you up on your feet
(Everybody get on up)
Moving you to a beat
(Can you feel it?)
[Interlude: Mr. Dalvin & K-Ci]
To our families, to our fans
For everybody who supported us
Thank you
Sincerely yours, Jodeci
(Ha, we're not gonna leave it alone, no, no)
Peace
(Confidence too high)
Jodeci, sing

[Chorus: Jodeci, K-Ci]
For those who thought we (For those who thought we), wouldn’t make it (Wouldn't make it)
But we had to, ‘cause we had our made up mind
(We drove for twelve long hours)
Success is not hard to find
(Looking for a place to sleep, looking for a place to eat)
For those who thought we (Ooh yeah), wouldn’t make it (Oh)
But we had to, ‘cause we had our made up mind (Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh)
Success is not hard to find (Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh)
For those who thought we, wouldn’t make it (Yeah)
But we had to, ‘cause we had our made up mind
(Most of all, we love each other)
Success is not hard to findEmbed
